main event: On 26th June 1956 in Plattsburg, New York, a ground-radar observation reported a round-shaped object, similar in size to a two-engine aircraft, descending and then disappearing from view for a period of two minutes.
interesting points: The observation lasted for two minutes and was made using ground-radar.
The object was described as round, descending, and the size of a two-engine aircraft.
A T-33 aircraft was in the area at the time of the sighting.
No intercept action was taken, and there was no physical evidence to support the sighting.
The conclusion was that the sighting was probably an aircraft, possibly generated from the T-33 aircraft in the area.
sighted object: round-shaped object, size of a two-engine aircraft
